      • write

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> write(java.lang.StringBuilder sql,
                                                              java.lang.Object... args)
                                                       throws java.lang.Throwable
        CRUD. Slower than fast write. Returns PK if DB generated. (But you should be using GUID due to distributed DB and just treat this as void, so mostly ignore results here).
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable

      • write

                                                              java.lang.StringBuilder sql,
                                                              java.lang.Object... args)
                                                       throws java.lang.Throwable
        Select the pool. Some DB drivers return data, others don't.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable

      • write

        public void write(org.apache.commons.pool2.impl.GenericObjectPool pool,
                  java.lang.StringBuilder sql,
                  java.lang.Object[][] argsA)
           throws java.lang.Throwable
        Faster CRUD. Lets you CRUD a few rows at once, by passing array of args for more than one row, for example when doing batch inserts or deletes. For example insert 10K or 100K rows at once before a disk write. Maybe set DB temp to RAM disk.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable

      • write

        public void write(java.sql.Connection con,
                  java.lang.StringBuilder sql,
                  java.lang.Object... args)
           throws java.lang.Throwable
        Fastest CRUD writer due to single async thread.
        Parameters:
        con - Should be a single connection you keep and never close dedicated to fast writer. TODO: Make that single connection local to this class.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable
